column4: I need to know how to troubleshoot an issue with DVD playback on this laptop. ATI x1250 using Ubuntu 8.10. I've installed the ubuntu-restricted-extras packages, vlc, xine, ogle and about anything else I can find to play DVDs, but every time I try to play a DVD, whether in mplayer, vlc, totem, xine or ogle, it fails to play. when I run xine from terminal I get a badalloc error stating a major opcode of failed request of 140 xvideo..
libdvdcss2 might be needed if its protected dvd
you can install just that one package from medibuntu if you want.
installed it......still failing when I try to open a dvd using vlc or mplayer from terminal....
when I try to open the dvd with movie player, it gives me an error saying it couldn't open the location and I might have permission ??????
here's what it says for that drive...../dev/scd0 /media/cdrom0 udf,iso9660 user,noauto,exec,utf8 0 0
hrm... have you tried more than one dvd?
I'll try again, but yes, I had earlier
it sounds like a codec issue to me though if you can get audio and no vid
hard to say install libdvdcss2 usually does the trick. I wouldtry a different movie just to be sure though.
